alert.note: Alert for Utah Valley; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80 (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 7:11PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Utah County through 745 PM MDT... At 710 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles south of Eagle Mountain, or 17 miles northwest of Payson, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Provo, Payson, Orem, Spanish Fork, Springville, Eagle Mountain, Lindon, Mapleton, Salem, Vineyard, Brigham Young University, Benjamin, Palmyra, Lake Shore, Utah Lake, West Mountain, Elberta, Saratoga Springs and Genola. This storm will be capable of producing strong gusty winds on Utah Lake. This will lead to a sudden increase in waves and very choppy waters which will result in hazardous boating conditions. Boaters are urged to seek safe harbor if possible. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 250 and 273. US Route 6 between mile markers 174 and 178. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Utah Valley; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80
